DataElement.preferredName: Patient Cerebellum Neurologic Function Assessment Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the indicator that asks whether the patient exhibited signs or symptoms of cerebellar dysfunction.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the neurologic assessment or evaluation of a patient/participant's cerebellum function, the portion of the brain in the back of the head between the cerebrum and the brain stem that controls balance for walking and standing, and other complex motor functions function or control of the movement of body parts.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: (sair-uh-BELL-um) The portion of the brain in the back of the head between the cerebrum and the brain stem. The cerebellum controls balance for walking and standing, and other complex motor functions.:(noor-uh-LOJ-ik) Having to do with nerves or the nervous system.:Function; what something is used for.:Examination of the body by auscultation, palpation, percussion, inspection, and olfaction.  (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: The portion of the brain located at the base of the skull that is responsible for balance, equilibrium and movement.
Pertaining to nerves or the nervous system.
The normal action performed by a structure or device.

A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the indicator that asks whether the patient exhibited signs or symptoms of cerebellar dysfunction.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated to add NCIt concept relationship. Updated VM Short Name to be the Public ID to be consistent with current convention for VM Short Name - DW 10-03-2022
ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.29 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. ak

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
